website_summaries.verdict: This 3D printer’s useful features and ability to consistently create smooth and precise prints makes it a great deal for the price.
cons: The lack of an on/off switch is an unfortunate deign choice

customer_reviews.title: Okay for PLA probably, but nothing else
customer_reviews.text: I never printed anything. I intended to take it on the road with a SD card full of parts that I need to be able to print. I quickly found out that the heated bed will not go over 60 degrees without being connected to a computer. I talked to monoprice support, lots of apologies, but the firmware locks out any temperature over 60 unless it is being driven by at least CURA on a computer, so you can't even modify the heated bed temperature gcode in the print files.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Thatcher

customer_reviews.title: unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: i have purchased 3 printers from monoprice in the last 2 weeks. 2 mini delta's and 1 mini. 1 mini and 1 delta are great. this delta sucks all the way around. noisy as compared to other, I can accept noise, this is noisy. Feed mechanism has intermittent problem and will cause major problems in middle of job. Will not produce the same print as 2 other models.....
customer_reviews.author: Carl Blum

customer_reviews.title: What a great little printer
customer_reviews.text: What a great little printer, especially for $159! The only cons are that like many people have reported, the Mini is quite noisy and the heated bed takes a while to heat up. That being said, once I got a profile in Simplify3D it prints beautifully and it's fast. As some reviewers on YouTube have said, this might not be the best choice for a first printer because it takes a little experience to get good results right out of the box. But I bought it as my second printer and at $159 its a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Kuenzel

customer_reviews.title: Dead after a year
customer_reviews.text: If you click on support on Amazon it says talk to Monoprice. When you call Monoprice they say since you bought it from Amazon they will support it. In the end ZERO SUPPORT. Monoprice WILL NOT repair the equipment even if you can pay, so you are left with having to figure out if any of the parts inside can be purchased from other sources and through trial and error figure out the problem. Not terribly eco-friendly to have to just toss a giant printer into the trash, but I will know not to buy another Monoprice 3D printer ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L.

customer_reviews.title: it was easy to set up and the prints are very nice
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous, this was my first printer. However, it was easy to set up and the prints are very nice. I did buy a glass print bed, which makes getting parts off super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: It works well overall.
customer_reviews.text: The manual is apparently on the micro SD card. Nice to know. First few days it didn’t work. I had to hack it, load different software, and then it worked. Then the lcd display started with the weird problem shown in photo. It’s like it got a scratch running through it inside? Not a user-error. I think the display has issues. The user community is broad and they all agree lots of parts need to be swapped out to make this a better printer. They recommend flashing firmware, and changing settings to make this work. I’m okay with results coming off this. Just remember this is a SMALL print size. Don’t be fooled. You can’t print anything of size.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Papa

customer_reviews.title: How to get your younger brother to do all the work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this & gifted it to my younger brother who knew nothing about 3D printers. I gave it to him for a reason which I'll get to later. He had no problems in figuring out how to use Cura, where to download "free" STL files and even learned to unclog a nozzle. I bought this exact same model for about $160. I just bought another, more expensive & even bigger Delta printer for myself & had my brother come to my house, put it together, show me how to use Cura, where to download STL files for free, tech support and how to perform preventive maintenance for the price of the mini Delta.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: The best choice for your 1st 3d printer
customer_reviews.text: If you want to just start your journey into the world of 3D printing, look no further. It comes preassembled, and is the perfect size for printing small objects. It's a small form factor, so you can fit it anywhere. Just note - she's pretty noisy! I would locate it somewhere away from where you normally spend your time - the basement, in my case. It doesn't need to be hooked up to a computer to do it's thing, as you can save your objects you are printing onto some portable memory and plug that into the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Magill

customer_reviews.title: It sounds cool but...
customer_reviews.text: it broke literally 41 days after purchase =( the bed level sensor got stuck, and then one of the arm belt dealios is broken, it works when its been sitting for a while but after about 5 minutes of use it begins to slip, obv throwing height off and skewing your print. I attempted to contact amz, they were worthless. being so soon, I wanted to return it but being past 30 days they referred me to MP direct who were very nice but ultimately I'm still left with a busted brand new ish printer. should have just spent the money for something Legit ish, Flux Delta looks like a very good printer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Decent simple printer Out Of Box
customer_reviews.text: took them out of the box, inserted micro SD card, turned printer on, loaded PLA filament and printed. The extruder motor is extremely weak so you need to pretty much make sure loose material is available to be fed for print. Some glitchy firmware issues where bed won't preheat for a print so you need to preheat manually then print. Extremely difficult to make SD Card fimrware backups. Recommend getting this as first printer to start rep-rap projects and move up. This is a great simple printer though out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Potter

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate Print
customer_reviews.text: My one and only print on this was a 49mm lens cap. It came out to 47mm. My CR-10 printed the same model perfectly. I went into this printer knowing that for the price I may have some issues. But a machine that can't print to a designed dimension is useless. Returned after one day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product but make sure you're willing to put in a little time.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is amazing! But be warned it's not Plug and Play. At first I was upset thinking I would return it because I couldn't figure out how to make it work. But if you give it a bit of time and do a little bit of studying watch a few YouTube videos it works amazing. If you're willing to put it in a tiny bit of effort this is amazing for the price.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Two perfect prints on first run...
customer_reviews.text: I printed two of the default cats using PLA and they are perfect. Instructions don’t match menus, but it was easy to figure out. I think I will be hooked. I will update review as I keep printing. I may need to get two of these. Great detail and easy to use so far.
customer_reviews.author: D. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: This is a great printer!
customer_reviews.text: My son is in a class that requires them to make things with the 3D printer in their class. He asked for one for Christmas and came across this one. The price was very reasonable and has spent many hours designing and creating different objects. I was doing a separate project and needed some tiny tweezers; he made me some that worked perfectly. This is a great product for beginners; although you do need access to programs like Inventor, etc. to create things.
customer_reviews.author: Melody McCauley

customer_reviews.title: Smooth right out of the box, Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: Works right out of the box. Documents are on the micro SD card provided, along with Cura and Repiter Host slicing software and 1 sample print. I wish it had an on/off switch. Only complaint here. Blue tape sheets & glue sticks work the best for adhesive on the print bed. I used 120c extruder heat and 50c heat on the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Mister J.

customer_reviews.title: Good printer, a bit small but the quality is great.
customer_reviews.text: X Y accuracy isn’t great, but it does the job. No leveling or calibration out of the box, it was basically plug and play. My only complaint is that he WiFi simply doesn’t work. Not a huge deal as I print from SD cards anyway, but if you were buying this printer for that purpose you may be disappointed. Print quality and speed are both good for the price. The build surface is small but usable. The knock off build tak they use really grips the rafts, I haven’t had any failed prints on this machine yet. Would recommend as a starter printer or a second or third machine. This will join my fleet.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little printer
customer_reviews.text: For the price I have not found a better printer. It is a little small but the quality of the prints it can produce is amazing for the price of the printer. Also It does take a while to zero in the setting on this printer, so if you are not ready for a lot of tweaking and looking up info for the printer this is not the printer for you. That being said after zeroing it in it is amazing. I do suggest getting a glass bed for the printer as it does improve the print quality and makes it easier to take prints off.
customer_reviews.author: KenderBob

customer_reviews.title: Annoying Bed Leveling Issues
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a great printer, but no matter what I've tried, prints will not lay down evenly on the first layer. They come unstuck and the hotend moves them around. The test print that came preloaded on the SD card did this as well. No matter how much tinkering I did with the software, manually trying to make the layers print evenly- the unevenness was still there. I spent multiple frustrating hours on trying to tinker with and fix the issue but nothing worked. I do not recommend this 3D Printer for beginners. It is way too frustrating. I'm still trying to get it to work how it should.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Salyers

customer_reviews.title: This is not a printer for beginners
customer_reviews.text: A beginner would be better off with a creality Ender 3 pro. As there is zero tech support for this item in America There is a community of people out there who use this printer and I have exchanged this one for another one thank you Amazon I hope the second one will actually work I don't think it was the shipping I think it was just a faulty printer to begin with I never got a single print completed it would not even home without it's sounding like gears were grinding
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Bagwell

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great economy printer. Works right out of the box. It has a heated bed and adjustable temperatures fir the bed and filament. Print by Wifi , USB or SD card. My only complaint is that the printed object may require scaling for size accuracy. You may also want to invest in a removable printing bed to preserve the original bed surface. The auto-leveling feature of the printer will adjust for the new bed height.
customer_reviews.author: hcdjr

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up cura slicer. Fast printing oh and i printed tpu wit it to
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer its my frist one i have to printers now and go back to this little bot all the time fast and auto bed leveal unlike my diy printer i have things that go wrong but with my mini delta its smooth only problum is dont lose the sd card i need a new one its picky on sd cards i need to order a stock sd card for it then iam back up and printing Peace n love
customer_reviews.author: Antione Motley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this printer non stop for over 3 months now. It has really impressed me. I got this one with 0 knowledge about 3D printing. Since then, I have had to fix it twice, but it was never difficult. I've learned a lot about how it works, and I have printed several upgrades for it directly from it. The repair parts I needed were both under $10 and right here on Amazon. This is definitely a great printer for beginners, or someone on a budget. I get compliments on the print quality all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Freeman Kingston

customer_reviews.title: 50/50 Satisfied with this printer
customer_reviews.text: I initially ordered this printer on December 27, 2018. After 11 days the Bowden connector failed and I returned it for a replacement. The replacement arrived on January 9 and 23 days later the Bowden connector failed again. Additionally, the left tower rod fails to return home. Mostly likely a damaged sensor. So I'm returning it again for an exact product exchange. Hopefully, third time will be a charm. Else I'll swap brands.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Davis

customer_reviews.title: Not for complete novices
customer_reviews.text: Not as easy to use as I had hoped, and the tac on the build plate has started to bubble and crack, I've only had it a week.. i just ordered a glass plate that has me remove all the black area before adhering it anyway so hopefully it helps... after buying it I watch a review that said it is not for novices because you do need to tweak settings for a proper print... I'm still working on it... sample cat printed perfect and I'm slowly improving prints as I go
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Kinda works?
customer_reviews.text: I have built 3d printers in the past, but this was a shot in the dark. It worked great and then....auto level does not work, heat sucks, x,y,z are not in the right place, software ...what software? Firmware is totally messed up, you will have to mess with this to no end to even get it to print. The python script for auto level sucks. I though this was going to be great...I am returning it Monday 2/24
customer_reviews.author: David Herron

customer_reviews.title: Great little printers.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these little guys. The good: They are fast and extremely good at detail, easy to use once you get them set up and they have easy to find replacement parts. The less than perfect: They jam just like any other 3D printer, so you will get very good at taking the hot end apart. The build space is tiny, so dont expect you will be making anything bigger than a coffee mug. Verdict: Buy one, or two! They are fantastic printers.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: 3D Printing is not for the Weak
customer_reviews.text: Here's what people need to realize about 3D printing, 80% of it is having a problem and using your wit and online resources to solve it. Each printer is unique. Be prepared to put in work to solve issues and you will have a fulfilling, fun hobby.
customer_reviews.author: millermiller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Results, Hard Setup
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is stunning.... once you get all the setting dialed in. This was my first printer, and, despite being a pre-built, there was a lot of work getting this up and running. This is an excellent printer, but I would have a hard time recommending it to my friends. I hope Monoprice makes a version 2 of the Mini Delta, because it really has potential. And yes, it is very loud.
customer_reviews.author: PJG

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little printer with the best community support.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st 3D printer. I don't know about the official tech support, but the community support is super great. The printer needed little tweaking, but it was all laid out and wonderfully written by the community. But what about the prints? I am really happy with it. Compared to some of the pictures I see on thingiverse or my friends, its definitely a good buy especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Donutsaur

customer_reviews.title: This is my 4th and best 3D printer
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 3d printers and this is my first Delta. It prints insanely fast. The quality is really good. This is a no brainer purchase if you even kinda want to try 3D printing. I'm slicing it at 150mm/s speed and then ramping it up to 1.5 speed and its screeeaaammmminnng fast. I'm going to keep running the heck out of it. I will update you all if something happens.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Save your time and your wallet!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is nothing but a waste of time, nothing but problems out ... of the box problems. Customer support is horrible if they even reply. My print quality over the last few months has been pretty much nonexistent.
customer_reviews.author: Evan S

customer_reviews.title: Added a star because I finally got the thing to work..
customer_reviews.text: There's a monoprice mini delta subreddit and an entire wiki full of valuable info. Not sure about offsite linking policy so just google it. Ultimately I upgraded the firmware and had to fix the steps per mm with a gcode file that I run everytime I boot up the machine. I'm not sure if one of the dozen or so steps I took leading up to that final fix played a part. I'm using a 3.6 cura profile that I manually imported into 4.0... it works (with the new firmware and steps per mm fix) Lots of trial and error.
customer_reviews.author: Cmon

customer_reviews.title: Worked well initially
customer_reviews.text: The printer worked well initially but the extruder would get stuck in one spot after 3 weeks of very light use. I bought this for my son thinking that it would be easy enough to print but it actually requires quite a bit of setup and file configuration each time I would print. T will say that the quality of the prints was really good.
customer_reviews.author: Gwink

customer_reviews.title: Not working out of the box...
customer_reviews.text: Currently rated one star because it does not work out of the box as advertised. When I select “print”, the first auto level point grinds into the bed and drags across into the corner. Then the second point does the same thing. The third auto level point seems to work properly. Once this step is complete, the printer tries to print properly, but doesn’t know where the bed is so the print immediately fails. Any advice will be appreciated and I’d be willing to change my rating once I see it work.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: No touch screen, but no need
customer_reviews.text: The Monoprice Mini Delta is a lovely work horse printer for its cost and size. I have printed very small objects, some only 1mm tall and 2 mm wide, and this printer didn't bat a cybernetic eye. It has printed everything I have asked with great quality. Only downside is the noise. If it was quieter, it would be perfect, but beyond that, it is a great machine.
customer_reviews.author: Syarnis

customer_reviews.title: Locate and follow instructions in the manual.
customer_reviews.text: The Monoprice Mini Delta 3D Printer I received had no documentation. That is the only problem I have had with this printer. If you locate the support WiKi, print out the manual and follow the instructions, the printer works great in my 3 weeks experience. I have printed 49 PLA objects with no problems with the printer.
customer_reviews.author: EdSeymore

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with computer
customer_reviews.text: A good delta printer for the price. Easy to carry around for teaching. First sample print looked good.Little and poor setup instructions from company. So far have got only the micro SD card printing working. The computer and printer will not communicate. An error message states a baud rate problem. I could not find error message notes anywhere including on Wiki. I have not tried the WiFi connection yet.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad little printer
customer_reviews.text: Been trying to run this printer into the ground i have had some issues with prints requiring a lot of support but overall it was a fairly easy printer to work with a you can find settings for Cura to add the printer there fairly easy on the internet. My Printer DID NOT have a color display so I was disappointed and caused it to loose a star as I feel it was not as shown.
customer_reviews.author: J. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Not for us
customer_reviews.text: We are beginners and really just wanted something we could use out of the box. We tried this based on my son saw the brand at school and trusted it - the price was also unbeatable. The test run kitty waving worked great and we were really excited. We had trouble getting anything to print anything else - not 1 item. Reading on line, people were swapping out parts, doing upgrades, adjustments, etc. Too much for us, we just want to print without any work. So we returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzie A

customer_reviews.title: Extreme Intuition Required.
customer_reviews.text: The software is outdated. Print files from a computer need to be manually set up by editing the goode. Your print will fail if it's not using the outdated gcode. I had to copy lines from the test print and paste in before the nozzle movement lines and preheating. It's recommended to not update as it will void the warranty. I did not get a manual with it, I had to find a PDF to properly operate it. It was ready out the box and the test print went well. Can't complain too much for the cost. Prints were robust. The plastic chisel is trash. Gently use a metal one if you have the option.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Newton

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this printer. A great starter printer that required some utilization of forums to create better builds and prints. But overall a great product, I do recommend getting a glass plate for the plate as the one provide does have the print come off during taller builds.
customer_reviews.author: Dyna85

customer_reviews.title: This printer is the best for small objects with great detail
customer_reviews.text: It's fast and can print with really high detail! It took me some time to set up the needed software (including editing the print code to adjust the level).Just be sure to slow it down for the base platform and first few layers. This printer is the best for small objects with great detail!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Dead On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: the printer never warms up to print. looking to return it
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S.

customer_reviews.title: Breaks quickly, but would otherwise be decent
customer_reviews.text: This printer prints pretty well for it's price, but that's only when it works. It gradually gains one problem after another with each print until you essentially can't use it anymore. Its auto-leveling is nice, but unless it works perfectly forever, it only makes it harder to use. The tiny, hard-to-replace print bed appeared to warp slightly, making the auto-level feature useless. This printer breaks before the warranty expires, so at least there's that. Unless you plan to do some hardcore modding on this printer, just save up for an ender 3 or something.
customer_reviews.author: RadSaturn

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother quality control really Is that bad!
customer_reviews.text: Quality control who needs that? So unboxed it and the extruder was broken... no problem I was going to put an EZR on it eventually so I slapped it on right away. Finally get it going and it is extruding like trash. Spent weeks off and on tinkering with it, not having any success. Come to find out they didn’t include the metal piece and set screw they hold the heat block & nozzle into place. Cannot believe that they sold such a from the box hunk of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Ventura

customer_reviews.title: get glue stick and painters tape
customer_reviews.text: it took us like 15 tries to get one to work - we needed the painters tape and glue stick trick to get it to stay down. the designs are stripey and can be pulled apart with our hands, which i wonder if thats a temperature issue? happy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mom3boys

customer_reviews.title: Great quality bad instructions
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality however cant use wifi because the app no longer exists in apple store. And doesnt connect to repetier host. Doesnt take any micro sd card except the one which came with it. Ive tried as small as 16gb with no luck would love to know how to setup wifi connection without app
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great print quality while it lasted (which is very short)
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the prints was surprising, but the printer only ever printed two things successfully. For the third time I tried to print something on it, it said sensor failed mid print and started dropping the temperature for both nozzle and the bed. Ever since then, it always print successfully to up until the last few minutes and then says sensor failed. It is funny though that for a 30 minutes print it has that error soon, but for a 2 hour print, it prints fine for 1 hour and 45 mins and then runs into sensor failed issue.
customer_reviews.author: Parash J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Powerhorse, for small designs...
customer_reviews.text: This printer is awesome. Solid base, sturdy everything is aluminum. The screen is not touchscreen but the buttons are very intuitive. The autolevel function works great, but it takes awhile to heat the bed to 59* ( mine never seems to be able to reach 60*). I had to change the starting G code so the Mini would wait until heated, because it would start printing right after autoleveling, no matter if the extruder was hot enough
customer_reviews.author: Infinite Velocity Inc

customer_reviews.title: Easy startup
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to get going. Slicer program was legit as others I have used was not that intuitive. Definitely would recommend for the price and precision.
customer_reviews.author: Mirrored Image Co.

customer_reviews.title: A cheap 3d printer with auto bed leveling.
customer_reviews.text: It has a small print area but it was all I needed. It seemed to work fine out of the box and not having to deal with manual bed leveling was a huge plus especially for my first 3d printer. The most difficult part is the process of going from 3D modelling software to a slicing program to the printer without any hitches. I had to learn Fusion 360 just to make the process easier since my 3D models from Maya weren't coming out correctly in the slicer software Cura.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It did not work at all, and couldn’t get a refund. My nephew was very sad, had to get a different one someplace else.
customer_reviews.author: Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Works great no problem high quality build and high quality printed.
customer_reviews.text: Everything works great but the motherboard fan dead after 3 days I replaced with 2 12v fan other works no problem print quality is really good this is my first 3d printer so I don't know about other printer but this one great.
customer_reviews.author: Tshais-2014

customer_reviews.title: Not for someone who is not technical..
customer_reviews.text: This is not the highest quality device, it requires a bit of messing around to get going good. If your technical that is fine but if not I may be fustrating. It sure is inexpensive and a good value. I am just a hobbiest but I am satisfied with the prints and have a lot of fun with it. The build area is small.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I've seen under $400... and for $400 you could almost buy 3!
customer_reviews.text: I've been 3-D printing since 2013. Of course this one has a much smaller build plates that I am used to, however I was seriously impressed with how well it functions right out of the box. PLA prints were every bit as good as printers have used in the past. ABS did not seem to hold onto the build plates and failed quickly but I'm confident that adding an acrylic shield and maybe turning up the temperature of the plates will bring better success. Overall, for $150 I would absolutely buy this printer again, in fact I might just buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Johnson

customer_reviews.title: No instructions
customer_reviews.text: Came with no instructions. Had one preloaded cat figurine loaded to print. So far that is all I’ve been able to print. And I learned Chrome doesn’t work on this. I’m going to use my other computer and see if I can get something else to print. It is fascinating to watch and if I can ever get anything else to print, I think this is a good printer so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Sherrow

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Here to clear up a few things: - You do have a solid chance of getting a good or bad one. - You can always get a replacement - And it has been six months, and this thing has been working.. Great. A good cheap 3D printer. The bedsheet does rip after a while but that probably won't happen to you because I accidentally used the wrong tools on it.
customer_reviews.author: erin caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Fast and impressive!!
customer_reviews.text: Prints amazing! Fast too! I'm printing in PLA at 90 mm/s with immaculate production. I wish the print bed was bigger. But only because it's that good! I knew the size going into it. ( Some prior 3d printing knowledge is required. It's not just plug in play )
customer_reviews.author: Chad C.

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This printer works great for both its size and cost. The self calibration feature is fantastic. I use this for printing miniatures for D&D and it does great quality for its abilities/cost.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Great starter 3-D printer
customer_reviews.text: Well-built; sturdy enough for my teenage son! Product description was exactly what we needed to know & what we received. Excellent value for a starter 3-D printer to learn how it all works. Would be great to have instructions on how to clean it or clear jams, but we figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs a better scraper and bed surface
customer_reviews.text: It works, super easy to use. The plastic scraper works for getting prints up, but is not great for removing brims and rafts. Metal scrapers easily remove the rough surface on the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Martin J

customer_reviews.title: Very misleading. It’s not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Only file that worked for me to cut was the cat file. Every file I tried to make wouldn’t print. It says you can cut right out the box but that’s not 100% true. If this printer was easier to use for a beginner like myself then I would have rated it 5 stars. However, that’s not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Ease of setup
customer_reviews.text: Monoprice could have setup Cura to print. It is not. A new user has to diggggg through poor documentation. To get the system to work. I think the company should identify their customers. I am tech savvy and thought I would use a 3d printer for making quadcopter parts. I am a retired systems analyst working systems easy to use. Monoprice needs to get the finger out........ Bob
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: The MiniDelta
customer_reviews.text: While it is good for starters, fully made and auto leveling. The bad is a very small bed and you can outgrow it in just a couple months if you plan to make props or statues.
customer_reviews.author: Ronai Sanzer

customer_reviews.title: Printing TPU out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I'm printing a small TPU model, but my other printer couldn't accept it. This can right out of the box, with no levelling and a little glue. Better than I hoped so far.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Lile

customer_reviews.title: Best budget friendly printer available!
customer_reviews.text: User friendly, very easy to set up and start printing. Still getting familiar with using Cura, but the printer itself is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Reliable for travelling shows
customer_reviews.text: Our Makespace is often requested to set up demos at schools and libraries. This little machine has been flawless, operating several times a week at our space, and more importantly, successfully traveling to many shows throughout the year. Never lets us down, and is so easy to carry and built like a tank.
customer_reviews.author: jjinsc

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: For the price of this 3D printer, it's great! Most of them are very expensive and if you are just starting out at this or just want to print some smaller things on your free time, this is the best option!
customer_reviews.author: corrin williams

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Printer basically stopped working after 32 days. Luckily Amazon called Monoprice and the Monoprice warranty is 1 year. I shipped the printer back WEEKS ago. And i still do not have a replacement. I have emailed the customer service rep Shafqat R about 30 times and constantly fails to do any research. I’m starting to think it is a sham. DO NOT PURCHASE - IVE BEEN HAD!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Stefanowich

customer_reviews.title: very poor instructions, flimsy construction, terrible for beginners
customer_reviews.text: My son bought this printer and we've been almost entirely unable to figure out how to use it. The sample print that it is programmed to do didn't work and it's got a ridiculously complex programming process. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I’ve had it for a few months now and the tech support is AMAZING! I just wish the product came with the default setting instead of us having to find them and replace them. Overall I’m happy with it and it’s grear machine to start with.
customer_reviews.author: bobbie

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect my only complaint is that the machine only adjusts temperature in increments of 5, and it has trouble holding a solid temperature. If they came out with a machine with a bigger power supply and a board to handle it I would buy it
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply, stay away. Buy something a bit more expensive. This thing will drive you crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Set Up, Reliable Afterwards
customer_reviews.text: So, long story short: the actual tech support from Monoprice for this product is nonexistent, but there's a faithful community of hobbyists that have made extensive guides and troubleshooting. If you follow the instructions EXACTLY without messing with the printer AT ALL before you start, it will run quite well for the price. Change ANY SETTINGS or send just about ANY gcode and it will instantly throw a fit and go nuts (as was my experience with this printer).
customer_reviews.author: Gote

customer_reviews.title: It’s trash
customer_reviews.text: Worst product ever only prints cats never ever buy if it’s you first printer don’t buy well don’t buy any way had two mono price printer and both sucked don’t buy it’s trash
customer_reviews.author: cardston

customer_reviews.title: Not the biggest printing bed but easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The printer was great the only problem was that for me the print bed was to small for most things and it was in a circle shape so I would recommend a 3d printer like the ender 3 for price to build size but if you wanna try 3d printing if you can buy this test it and if you don't like the printer return it and get a refund like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Grace DiLIsi

customer_reviews.title: Good printer but not for first timers
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 3D Printer and i was very pleasantly surprised, it was ready to go right out of the box, however i would not recommend to someone without tech savy. Not very much out there on initial setup in cura or matter control so if you have few tech skills it will be a challenge
customer_reviews.author: Jay Griffith

customer_reviews.title: This is the part of the review that you are forced to write something even though you don't want to.
customer_reviews.text: This is the part of the review that you are forced to write something even though you don't want to.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Function
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a present for my adult son. He loves it. Works great. Good for someone with a technical background.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Husband

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: After tweaking the gcode a bit, this is actually a great little printer. Auto bed leveling is simple but works well. Prints are looking good.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: ... had communications problem on the third print support was great they are going to replace
customer_reviews.text: it had communications problem on the third print support was great they are going to replace it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: Auto bed level is great, if you have the right start g-code. Stringing is an issue, however you’ll just have to play with your slicer settings. The only downfall is you have to use raft as build plate adhesion. I’ve tried every other one with no luck. Also this is a fast little printer. Printed great quality at 200.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Really. Take it out of the box, plug it in, stick some PLA filament (not included) in, let it warm up, push a button. It prints a figurine off the included memory card. Just a beginner, I've enjoyed designing a small part with Tinkercad (free online), slicing it with Cura (also free) and printing something new every night this week.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Bolenbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is amazing. Unbelievable print quality for a machine under $200.00. I also have a $45k Stratasys Fortis and this little machine prints almost as good! I bought 3 of them. 1 for me, my brother, and my daughter. We all love them. I really question reviews that are unhappy with this printer. Anyone with half a brain would figure it out and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good price and idea, not for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't print anything but the demo and eventually it stops printing that. Return
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute trash
customer_reviews.text: I originally had written a positive review about this product, but after using if for just a few months I am utterly disappointed. It constantly has errors, it's impossible to clean when filament gets stuck and the parts are cheap. Do not recommend, spend a few extra dollars and get something better, mine became a paperwaleight within just a couple months
customer_reviews.author: Gingy jingleballs

customer_reviews.title: not even for the price
customer_reviews.text: build area way too small. Okay this is on me it was clear in the description about small size. poor USB connectivity. poor quality prints when you can get it to print. just not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's not for beginners.  It's garbage
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this printer and it's supposed to be for beginners and that's a crock of crap. Iv had it for months and still can not get 1 thing to print. It's garbage
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Out of box and printing in 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Awesome machine. Great beginner printer. Comes with prints already loaded on sd card. No set up out of box and printing in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY!!
customer_reviews.text: It printed the test figure but would not print anything else. Spent 2 days with there support which they didn’t seem to know what they were doing or even care to even help. The programming that came with it messed my computer up as well and they are not willing to fix it. I would stay away from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful printer for beginners but you are limited with print size and it’s easy to use if you have background in technology and innovation.
customer_reviews.author: tWINKLE

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to make toys and knick knacks for a school club. Does its job supremely well!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Pee

customer_reviews.title: Not a goodd product
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this as there is nonclear instructions on how tonset it up. Highly regret buying this
customer_reviews.author: Anusha Vimal

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, this did not work. The printer would begin making an object, then after a while, the object would not stick together & would turn into a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Gail O Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable, bad tech support
customer_reviews.text: Printed out nice smooth, fast. Easy to set up, but not reliable. Working only 3 weeks and get error. “Hotend1 temperature fault or power is insufficient” call tech support there was no help. Technician request sent the video shown the printing and error to website.
customer_reviews.author: ron nguyen

customer_reviews.title: SD card reader finicky
customer_reviews.text: Printer was very finicky about what sd card it would read, until finally it stopped reading any card. After that it was time to either replace it or get a different one. I will give it another try before completely giving up on it.
customer_reviews.author: Docmark

customer_reviews.title: Best price/value 3D printer out there
customer_reviews.text: After looking for the best printer in terms of price/quality. I've come across the monoprice. I'm using the 3D printer for prototyping and modeling and it was important for me to reach the 60 microns resolution. I wasn't disappointed. This machine definitly delivers!! And watch the YouTube review of Drvax. Over there you'll get links a special website that tells you how to maximize your prints by changing some default codes in Cura. Oveall. BIG LIKE.
customer_reviews.author: Gal Hiltch

customer_reviews.title: Had to return it.
customer_reviews.text: Would only print the sample file regardless of the file chosen. May have been a fluke or user error, but I don't think so and couldn't take that chance before it was too late. So I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: I love this little beaut
customer_reviews.text: If you want a starter, this one will give you that little extra boost. Deltas are picky, but can show you the principles and the path to learn 3D printing. This one did.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory S

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this printer.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a family Christmas present. We have tried everything and can’t get it to print anything but the test “cat”. It will not connect via Wi-Fi or usb and we have tried multiple computers. Technical support has been no help at all. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Landon

product_meta.title: Monoprice Delta PRO 3D Printer with (270 x 300 mm) Heated Glass Build Plate, Auto Leveling, Triple Fan, PID Tuning, Fully Assembled
product_meta.description: Style:Delta Pro (270 x 300 mm)The delta Pro 3D printer is simple, elegant, powerful, and robust created for the enthusiast and professional alike. It is easy to use with auto bed leveling, heated plate, and WiFi built in and can be assembled in 30 minutes or less. It is built with reliability in mind using quality Japanese and German components, machined effector plate, magnetic effector arms, and machined hot end. Accuracy is key with its glass plate, build volume, and robust main board. The delta Pro 3D printer stands in a Class of its own for the makers who want stunning quality, speed, and ease of use.
feature_bullets: Auto bed level: no longer will you have to chase the perfect bed level using hex keys & feeler gauges. The new auto bed leveling system allows you to spend less time getting that perfect print started
Extra large build volume: the extra large, 270 x 300 mm build volume lets you make full prints of models that would otherwise need to be printed separately and assembled afterward
All metal construction: all structural parts and parts related to printing are constructed with metal, fitting together with no room for unwanted movement or warping from external forces
Auto pid tuning: the ambient temperature of your environment affects your print. Maintain consistent temperatures during printing by taking advantage of built in pid tuning

Fully assembled quiet performance: the delta pro ships fully assembled & ready to print out of the box, so you can spend more time printing & less time prepping. The printer operates at less than 50Db

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
